Key Match Events: Cam Whitmore scored 18 points off the bench and teamed with Alperen Sengun to lead a decisive second-quarter run.
Sengun tallied 23 points, six rebounds, four assists, and five steals.
Whitmore and Sengun combined to score 20 points during a 23-4 run that turned a 10-point deficit into a 53-44 lead.
Houston's Jalen Green scored 22 points while Dillon Brooks added 19 points and six rebounds.
Klay Thompson posted 16 points and four 3-pointers for the Mavericks, while Kyrie Irving added 16 points, seven rebounds, three steals, and two blocks.
The Mavericks lost P.J. Washington to a right knee sprain and he did not return for the second half.
Quentin Grimes led the Mavericks with 17 points, and Jaden Harden scored 10 points apiece in the first half for Dallas.
